tidysq 1.0
  • Reference

Extract k-mers from sequences

Source: R/kmers.R
extract_kmers.Rd

Extracts vector of k-mers present in sequence(s).

extract_kmers(sq, lens = 0, dists = list(0))

Arguments

sq

a vector or matrix describing sequence(s).
lens

integer vector of lengths of k-mers.
dists

integer vector of distances between elements of k-mer (0 means consecutive elements). See Details.

Value

A character matrix of k-mers, where every row corresponds to a different sequence.

Details

A format of d vector is discussed in Details of count_kmers.

Examples

set.seed(1410)
random_sqs <- random_sq(3, 5, type = "nuc", is_clean = TRUE)

# 1-mers
extract_kmers(random_sqs, lens = 1, dists = list(0))
#> # A tibble: 15 x 2
#>    origin_sq  kmer 
#>    <(c)nuc>   <chr>
#>  1 ATCGC  <5> A_0  
#>  2 ATCGC  <5> T_0  
#>  3 ATCGC  <5> C_0  
#>  4 ATCGC  <5> G_0  
#>  5 ATCGC  <5> C_0  
#>  6 CAUTT  <5> C_0  
#>  7 CAUTT  <5> A_0  
#>  8 CAUTT  <5> U_0  
#>  9 CAUTT  <5> T_0  
#> 10 CAUTT  <5> T_0  
#> 11 CCGUU  <5> C_0  
#> 12 CCGUU  <5> C_0  
#> 13 CCGUU  <5> G_0  
#> 14 CCGUU  <5> U_0  
#> 15 CCGUU  <5> U_0  

# 2-mers with and without gap
extract_kmers(random_sqs, lens = c(2, 2), dists = list(0, 1))
#> # A tibble: 21 x 2
#>    origin_sq  kmer 
#>    <(c)nuc>   <chr>
#>  1 ATCGC  <5> A.T_0
#>  2 ATCGC  <5> T.C_0
#>  3 ATCGC  <5> C.G_0
#>  4 ATCGC  <5> G.C_0
#>  5 ATCGC  <5> A.C_1
#>  6 ATCGC  <5> T.G_1
#>  7 ATCGC  <5> C.C_1
#>  8 CAUTT  <5> C.A_0
#>  9 CAUTT  <5> A.U_0
#> 10 CAUTT  <5> U.T_0
#> # … with 11 more rows
